sec.p: The Phytochemical Society of Europe

The Phytochemical Society of Europe (PSE) was founded in 1957. Its aim is to promote natural products research by supporting the organization of several international meetings a year. The Society’s main interests are related to the chemistry, functions, biosynthesis, and effects of natural compounds on the physiology and pathology of living organisms and the application of such knowledge in agriculture and industry.

sec.title: 1. PSE meetings
sec.p: During 19 -22 June 2019 , the PSE Young Scientists Meeting Trends in Natural Product Research: On Biochemistry, Molecular Aspects and Pharmacology of Bioactive Natural Products took place in Budapest, chaired by Prof. Judit Hohmann. The Symposium was organised jointly by the PSE, the University of Szeged, Faculty of Pharmacy and Institute of Pharmacognosy, the Committee on Pharmaceutical Sciences, and the Hungarian Academy of Sciences. The programme of the conference covered different aspects of natural product research, including phytochemistry, molecular biology, phytochemical analysis, bioactivity of natural products, phytotherapy. The aim of the conference was to serve as a forum for discussions on trends, most current topics and latest results of natural product research, and to bring together senior scientists, young researchers, and PhD students from all over the world. The scientific programme included 15 plenary lectures by leading scientists, keynote talks, 33 oral presentations and 37 poster presentations. In this YSM, several young scientists were awarded prizes. The Jeffrey Harborne Prize for the best oral presentation was given to Nóra Gampe, while the Phytochemical Analysis /Wiley prizes went to Johanna Gasser, Agata Rogowska, and Aimond Axelle. In addition, the PSE supported five young scientists with travel bursaries: Gokay Albayrak, Odeta Celaj, Afaf Al Groshi, Shaymaa Al-Majmaie and Marie Pokorná. The PSE/Pierre Fabre Innovation Award 2019 went to Prof. Marc Diederich ( Seoul , South Korea ), who, as always, delivered an inspiring lecture. Further information can be found at: https://ysm2019.weebly.com/.

During
28 –31 July 2019
the
Natural Products in Drug Discovery and Health –NatProDDH
conference was organised in Lisbon , Portugal by
Prof.
Maria José Umbelino Ferreira.
The Faculty of Pharmacy of the University of Lisbon amassed an exciting group of Natural Products researchers, bringing together 270 senior scientists, young researchers, and PhD students from 37 countries to share their latest advances. The attractive program of NatProdDDH covered the state-of-the-art in natural products research, up to their application as value-added products for human health. Through plenary sessions, lectures, poster presentations and coffee breaks, the participants took advantage of this propitious environment for the generation of innovative ideas, networking, and making new contacts. Profs : Francisco A Macias , University of Cadiz ( Spain ), Satyajit Sarker , University of Liverpool John Moores ( UK ), Simon Gibbons , University College London ( UK ), Virginia Lanzotti , University of Naples Federico II ( Italy ), Robert Verpoorte , University of Leiden ( The Netherlands ), Artur Silva , University of Aveiro ( Portugal ), Franz Bucar , University of Graz ( Austria ), Hermann Stuppner , University of Innsbruck ( Austria ), Giovanni Appendino , University of Eastern Piedmont ( Italy ), Deniz Tasdemir , GEOMAR Helmholtz Centre for Ocean Research Kiel ( Germany ), Randolph Arroo , University of De Montfort Leicester ( UK ). Strnad Miroslav , University of Olomouc ( Czech Republic ), Isabel CFR Ferreira , Polytechnic Institute of Bragança ( Portugal ), Jianbo Xiao , University of Macao ( China ), Vassilios Roussis , University of Athens ( Greece ), Emerson F. Queiroz , University of Geneva ( Switzerland ), Wim Dehaen , University of Leuven ( Belgium ) and Thomas Efferth , Johannes Gutenberg University ( Germany ) were invited speakers. Additionally 53 oral communications were delivered and 165 posters were presented. Five PSE travel grants were awarded to: Taofiq Oludemi ( Portugal ), Daniela Correia da Silva ( Portugal ), Vera de Macedo Ribeiro ( Portugal ), Amruta Deshpande ( Ireland ) and Diana Patricia Rey Padilla ( Colombia ). The Wiley prizes were given to Elisa Bonandi ( Italy ) and Joao Dutra-Gomes ( Brazil ). Further information can be obtained at: (https://www.ff.ul.pt/pselisbonmeeting2019/).
An attractive programme of conferences is planned for 2020 and further information can be found at the PSE website: www. phytochemicalsociety.org

This time the 4-ISPMF will take place in the beautiful city of Xi’an , during
25 – 30 June 2020
Xi’an is the capital of Shaanxi Province , China and it is one of the oldest cities in China . It has held the position under several of the most important dynasties in Chinese history and is the location of the famous terracotta army. Each winner will be awarded US$ 250 in cash and a certification provided by International Association of Food Nutrition and Safety. sec.title: 2. PSE – Pierre Fabre Award
sec.p: Pierre Fabre is the 2 nd largest private French pharmaceutical group and the 2 nd largest dermo-cosmetics laboratory in the world. From its very beginning, Pierre Fabre Laboratories have always explored and used plants as they are truly convinced of their great potential for health and beauty. For more information you are invited to visit their website at http://www.pierre-fabre.com

Candidatures are invited for the Phytochemical Society of Europe-Pierre Fabre Research Institute Joint Prize to be given in 2020. The prize of 3000€ will be awarded to the candidature considered to have made an exceptionally significant contribution to innovative research in phytochemistry.
Applicants for the 2020 PSE-PF Prize are invited to submit their application before 31 December 2019 directly to the PSE President (profsarker@gmail.com). The application should include:
– a short CV
– a summary (2-4 pages) highlighting the candidate’s cutting edge research in phytochemistry
– letters of support from two or three independent referees

For further information on the application, visit the PSE website http://phytochemicalsociety.org/?page_id=11976 The call is opened to any scientist from PhD to skilled researcher. The awardee will be invited to deliver an oral presentation during The 12th International Congress on Natural Products Research (ICNPR), to be held July 25 - July 30, 2020 at the Hyatt Regency – San Francisco.

sec.title: 3. The Phytochemical Society of Europe
sec.p: In order to advance phytochemical research, the PSE undertakes a number of activities:
• Organization of several scientific meetings each year and publication of the proceedings in the peer-reviewed journal Phytochemistry Reviews ’.
• The PSE–Bruker Prize, awarded annually to an outstanding phytochemist.
• The Jeffrey Harborne Prize, given to a young scientist in recognition of an outstanding oral and/or poster presentation at a PSE Young Scientists’ Meeting.
• The Pierre Fabre Innovation Award in recognition of an exceptionally significant contribution to innovative research in phytochemistry.
• The provision of Travel Bursaries for young scientists to enable them to present their research at PSE meetings.
Benefits of PSE membership
Membership of the PSE is worldwide and open to anyone with an interest in plant natural products and related fields. Members benefit from:
• Reduced registration fees for PSE meetings.
• Regular mailing and/or e-mailing of information.
• Up-to-date information on the PSE website.

• Reduced subscription rates for the journals Phytochemistry , Phytochemistry Letters and Phytochemistry Reviews . Reduced prices are available to members for some books from Publishers associated with these journals.
